result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Instructions on How to Appear Remotely by Zoom for the week of September 26, 2022

4:45 PM Defendant Kevin William Knapp in court.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck in court for Kevin William Knapp.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
950/Marsy's Law complied with. 
Court notes Atty Limbeck was appointed on both cases and is in compliance with Day Reporting. 
Atty Limbeck got last of digital discovery about a week ago and turned over a copy to the Deft. Notes that there is a 911 call referenced in the complaint and does not have a copy of it. Believes there is a good chance this will proceed to Trial.
DA Urmanski notes that most agencies are sending 911 calls separately. 
DA Urmanski will reach out to Atty Limbeck further regarding resolution.
State requests 3 weeks.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
